content.question: For which of the following functions would the quotient rule be considered the best method for finding the derivative?

choices.label: <math alttext="y equals, open parenthesis, x cubed, plus x, close parenthesis, to the negative 2 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, the fraction with numerator x cubed, plus x, and denominator x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, the inverse cosine of, open parenthesis, x cubed, plus x, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, the fraction with numerator the cosine of, open parenthesis, x cubed, plus x, close parenthesis, and denominator x cubed, plus x, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="y equals, the fraction with numerator the cosine of, open parenthesis, x cubed, plus x, close parenthesis, and denominator x cubed, plus x, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
